verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the land <WH776> shadowing <WH6767> with wings <WH3671>, which is beyond <WH5676> the rivers <WH5104> of Ethiopia <WH3568>:

That sends <WH7971> ambassadors <WH6735> by the sea <WH3220>, even in vessels <WH3627> of bulrushes <WH1573> upon <WH6440> the waters <WH4325>, saying <WH3212>, Go, you swift <WH7031> messengers <WH4397>, to a nation <WH1471> scattered <WH4900> and peeled <WH4178>, to a people <WH5971> terrible <WH3372> from their beginning until now <WH1973>; a nation <WH1471> measured out <WH6978> and trodden down <WH4001>, whose land <WH776> the rivers <WH5104> have spoiled <WH958>!

All you inhabitants <WH3427> of the world <WH8398>, and dwellers <WH7931> on the earth <WH776>, see <WH7200> you <WH5375>, when he lifts up a ensign <WH5251> on the mountains <WH2022>; and when he blows <WH8628> a trumpet <WH7782>, hear you <WH8085>.

For so <WH3541> the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto me <WH8252>, I will take my rest, and I will consider <WH5027> in my living place <WH4349> like a clear <WH6703> heat <WH2527> upon herbs <WH216>, and like a cloud <WH5645> of dew <WH2919> in the heat <WH2527> of harvest <WH7105>.

For before <WH6440> the harvest <WH7105>, when the bud <WH6525> is perfect <WH8552>, and the sour grape <WH1155> is ripening <WH1580> in the flower <WH5328>, he shall both cut off <WH3772> the sprigs <WH2150> with pruning hooks <WH4211>, and take away <WH5493> and cut down <WH8456> the branches <WH5189>.

They shall be left <WH5800> together <WH3162> unto the birds <WH5861> of the mountains <WH2022>, and to the animals <WH929> of the earth <WH776>: and the birds <WH5861> shall summer <WH6972> upon them <WH929>, and all the animals of the earth <WH776> shall winter upon them <WH2778>.

In that time <WH6256> shall the present <WH7862> be brought <WH2986> unto the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> of a people <WH5971> scattered <WH4900> and peeled <WH4178>, and from a people <WH5971> terrible <WH3372> from their beginning until now <WH1973>; a nation <WH1471> measured out <WH6978> and trodden under foot <WH4001>, whose land <WH776> the rivers <WH5104> have spoiled <WH958>, to the place <WH4725> of the name <WH8034> of the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, the mountain <WH2022> Zion <WH6726>.
